<<Accounts>>

First, let's go over a few housekeeping items. I am the avatar version of Daniel so you can't ask me questions directly. When you need help you can pay a small fee to talk to the real me by clicking "Schedule Zoom"

<<Accounts>>

If you get lost you can select the back button (in this window) or even reset the whole avatar by selecting Manage Coach.
move_to: zoom_link
Buttons can be short, default to 'Next' no text added on line, or even two sentences. Can also have multiple selections if asking a question.

<<Accounts>>

Welcome [[user_first_name]] to MyBudgetCoach! You just made a GREAT financial decision. ðŸ¥‚ðŸŽ‰ MyBudgetCoach is different because it comes with a real-life coach AND a digital avatar to make sure you are successful. You selected Daniel as your coach!

<<Accounts>>

Oh and since I'm actually a real person (no offense ChatGPT) I'll be sharing a few personal things about me as we go. That way when you decide to chat in real life we will already be best friends.
Hi Daniel, Let's get Started!
Nice, I can book a call if needed
Good to know
Awesome, I love friends!

<<Accounts>>

I will be going over everything with you to get you started. I will even help you build a budget WITHOUT tracking every single purchase.
Chill bro, we just met ðŸ˜‚
Great! Nobody has time for that!

<<Accounts>>

MyBudgetCoach will introduce a new method for managing your money, which may get a little tricky initially, but with me as your coach, I'll guide you through a simple process to ensure you stay committed to budgeting for years to come.

<<Accounts>>

Soooo, here is the list of what we will be going over: 
1. Account Tour & Setup
2. How to Add Transactions 
3. Budget Tour & Setup
4. Budget Skills

<<Accounts>> / <<Budget>>

This aligns the avatar with which screen the user should be on. If a user goes to the Budget at a step where the avatar flow has <<Accounts>>, or if the user goes to an Account while the avatar is on Budget, the user will see the following message:

 Please navigate to the Accounts {Budget} to continue our conversation (please select an account).

Please Note: There needs to be a blank line between the reference to Accounts/Budget and the text shown in the avatar window.

<<Accounts>>

Now for the fun part! Let's name your budget. 

Click on the downward arrow 
(ðŸ‘ˆ the one with the yellow square around it) Click â†’ Rename Budget (Press ENTER to make it official).

For example: Getting My Life Together, Adulting Hard, Last Name Budget of Great Happiness, Fresh Start, Dark Hole, A New Hope, You Got This, Dolla Dolla Bills Y'all...

I like it! Before we get too far, I have a few questions to better guide your setup experience.
move_to: center_screen
Account Setup Process

<<Accounts>>

Now click "Create Local Account". Name your account and then enter the current balance of that account. 

The Type will be 'budget: checking' if you're using a checking account

<<Accounts>>

Ready? Select + Add Account!

<<Accounts>>

I like it! 

For this step, you'll need to log into your bank and see the current balance. Come back to me when you've got that information!

NO
credit_cards = no

<<Accounts>>

Let's keep going. Do you have credit cards that you use regularly? (Yes/No)

<<Accounts>>

Now click "Create Local Account." Name your account (stay away from general terms like Credit Card 1) and then enter the current balance of that account.

The Type will be 'budget: credit card'

<<Accounts>>

Ready? Select + Add Account!

<<Accounts>>

For this step, you'll need to log into your credit card and see the current balance. Come back to me when you've got that information!

YES
credit_cards = yes
move_to: add_account
Budget Summary Overview

<<Budget>>

It's time for what you came here for. Get your coffee/tea ready cause it's Budget Time!

<<Budget>>

I'll give you a tour of your budget screen. Here you can see the current month as well as previous and future months.
I clicked calendar #3!

<<Budget>>

Let's say you want to compare several months at once. Depending on your browser zoom level, you can select up to six months at a time. Please click the third calendar icon.
move_to: calendar_icons

<<Budget>>

Now you can view three months. Let's change the view so you can see a different set of months using the purple selection.
move_to: months_band

<<Budget>>

Below the current month, there are several pieces of information and an amount labeled "To Budget."
move_to: budget_header

<<Budget>>

While you're getting to know MyBudgetCoach, just focus on the amount to budget for now.

Think of this number as real dollars you have to move into different envelopes. If you didn't earn it yet you can't budget it.

<<Budget>>

Click on the purple number to see some options for this amount. There are multiple ways to move money around your budget. After all, it's meant to be flexible!

<<Budget>>

Let's move onto the next part!
Budget Table Overview

<<Budget>>

This is the Budget Table, basically a digital cash envelope system! You create categories relevant to your life and budget dollars accordingly.

<<Budget>>

The Category column houses the names of each category. We'll get customizing these in a bit.

<<Budget>>

The Budgeted column is where you'll be budgeting your dollars. This shows you what you have allocated each month for the categories.

<<Budget>>

Next up is the Spent column. This shows you what you've actually spent out of the budgeted dollars.

<<Budget>>

The last column is Balance. This shows you what you have available to spend. If it's negative and red, you've overspent in this category. If the amount is black, that's what you have available.

<<Budget>>

If you don't cover this overspending, you either risk over-drafting your checking account or adding debt to your credit card. More on this later!

<<Budget>>

Take a look at the three dots to the right ðŸ‘‰ of Category. (under the undo/redo buttons)

This gives you visual options. You can collapse and expand category groups. You can also show and hide hidden categories.

<<Budget>>

When you hover over a row, an arrow appears. You have options to add a category in this group, hide it, rename it or delete it.

<<Budget>>

You can add more categories to a Category Group by clicking the dropdown arrow to the right of the Category Group name. 

In a moment, I will add my favorite template and you can modify it as needed.

<<Budget>>

Great Job!
Add Transaction

<<Accounts>>

Next up, let's practice adding a transaction on your checking account. Please click on your checking account tab on the left to get started!

<<Accounts>>

For checking account transactions, payments DECREASE the balance and deposits INCREASE the balance.

<<Accounts>>

Click "+ Add New" and type "Cell Phone Company" as your Payee.

<<Accounts>>

For the category, select "Bills." Now, enter $100 in the Payment box.

<<Accounts>>

Finish this transaction by 
1. Selecting the check mark to turn it green. 
2. Click "Add". 
3. Select "Cancel" to get out of adding transactions.

<<Accounts>>

Notice the account balance is minus $100.
move_to: account_balance

<<Accounts>>

Let's delete this pretend transaction. Hover your mouse over the date. Check the checkbox on the transaction you are deleting.

<<Accounts>>

Great Work, Way to get it done!

<<Accounts>>

To the right hand side of the search box, select the purple text with '1 transaction' to see a series of options.

Select 'Delete' to remove that transaction.

This Account Set-Up section could be expanded. Could ask the user questions related to how many checking accounts / how many credit cards / the type of account structure the user has (joint / separate / single...)

The template has 
just one 'adding a transaction' example. However, you as the coach could use the credit cards question from before, to use the database to have additional sections for a credit card transaction, and walking through how a transfer (payment to a credit card) works in the bank account and credit card.
Trusting Your Numbers

One of the complexities for users with a zero-based budgeting software is the due diligence to ensure the account balances in MyBudgetCoach match the account balances in the financial institution. 

A difficult part of having the accounts match is ensuring the starting balance set by the user at the time the accounts are added are accurate. For checking accounts, some banks include pending transactions in the Current Balance. If the starting balance includes pending transactions, then when the transactions are added, they will be double counted. For credit cards, the Current Balance doesn't include pending transactions, so this is not an issue. 

Coach can consider consulting Coach Trainers to add a flow for verifying starting balance.
Coach should consider adding a flow for walking a user through how to link accounts with SimpleFin. Consult with Coach Trainers if interested in sample flow.
Consider having a question to create a break for the user. Could also reference the earlier list of steps to complete, and show progress by crossing out those pieces that are done.
Insert wrap-up

<<Budget>>

...one last thing before I leave you to your budgeting...
Of course

<<Budget>>

Can you answer 3 short questions for me? I want to make sure I continue to improve how helpful I am!
I submitted the form

<<Budget>>

Great! Here's the link: https://airtable.com/appYAaDkGzB3ecOzl/shrUnpE9sHBWWDMyB

<<Budget>>

Thanks so much! Happy budgeting!
User Survey after Tutorial
Credit Card Overview
Budget Skills

<<Budget>>

Oh Man, that was a lot! It gets easier and easier each week. You got this!!!

<<Budget>>

Remember to book a call. You want to make sure you have a strong foundation.

<<Budget>>

Coach option to offer email for users to contact you directly prior to a call. Could help with triaging if a call is needed, versus hopping on a call and then realizing there isn't enough information.

People who have Credit Card balances in excess of their available dollars in their checking account will have a negative amount To Budgeted. This is an important step for the user, but can be handled in a various number of ways. Consider the main steps the user needs to complete, and then determine as the coach if you want to add more detail for any of those steps:

1) Adding the Credit Card Category Group
2) Add a Category for each Credit Card
3) Changing the category on the account side of the Credit Card starting balance to the newly created Category
4) Rollover overspending if not going to pay off balance

This will give the user back their dollars in their checking account in the To Budgeted.

<<Budget>>

If you carry a credit card balance that is more than what is in your checking, your To Budgeted amount will turn negative. I'll show you how to fix this later.
Budget Setup

You as the Coach can do as much or as little as you would like for the user. For example, if you just want to add a handful of categories, or walk them through how to edit and add themselves, that is fine. Alternatively, you could have the system build an entire budget with defined groups, and categories, so when they select the button before the template is built, it automatically updates.

<<Budget>>

Boom! That was fun.
Give it to me NOW!

<<Budget>>

You've learned a lot about MyBudgetCoach, so I'm going to show you my favorite budget template. I'll teach you how to modify it so it fits your unique financial situation.

<<Budget>>

Take a few minutes to go over these categories. Notice how we have three major groups 
1. Spend 
2. Recurring 
3. Stacks
Don't Edit - Keep link and keep text

This is the end of the tutorial. Your coach avatar will come back if you program a trigger. Once you are a launched coach, reach out to Coach Trainers for additional steps to set-up a trigger for your avatar to re-join the user at certain times.

For example, 15th and 31st of the month to verify Budgeted down to $0 newly received income.

COMING SOON:

Template flow for linking accounts via SimpleFIN.

<<Budget>>

The Spend group will include categories such as groceries, car fuel, lunches/snacks, and random small spending. This group is designed for all those little purchases that can sometimes get out of control.

<<Budget>>

We find that people stay on track and have more success when budgeting is a weekly habit.

<<Budget>>

The Second group is Recurring. Since you are so smart you might have realized that there are two Recurring groups. The First is Recurring BILLS that you pay directly out of your checking account. Think utilities.

<<Budget>>

The Second is Recurring Credit Card CHARGES. These are monthly credit charges. Think Cable, Netflix, Gym memberships, etc...

If you don't use a credit card you can move all of these items into one big Recurring group.

<<Budget>>

The third category is Stacks, reserved for less frequent but significant expenses such as home repairs, holidays, birthdays, vacations, or purchasing a new car. I keep my Stacks in Ally, but any other high-yield savings account or primary checking account will work!

<<Budget>>

If you want me to explain this in detail for your specefic situation, book a call with me and I'd be happy to make sure you are set up correctly.

<<Budget>>

Great job sticking through that. This is the end of the Budget section. Lets move on to adding a credit card.
Link to https://giphy.com/gifs/breaking-bad-money-season-5-QVgU7wEY0RlV6

<<Budget>>

StoryTime

When I was in college I maxed out my Credit Cards. Not a proud moment but nothing you can't come back from. 

Now, lets move on to Budget Skills

<<Budget>>

One of my favorite Stacks is the Vacation Spend Money Stack. This way I have money to spend when I go snowboarding with my wife and boys without feeling guilty.

<<Budget>>

Welcome to the Budget Skills. This is the most important part because when you follow these steps every week you will turn into a budgeting ninja. ðŸ±â€ðŸ‘¤

<<Budget>>

In case you haven't noticed there is a little handy Undo and Redo button here for quick fixes.

<<Accounts>>

Now, you need to pick a time weekly to update your budget and pay bills. Ideally you would have this day on or a few days after you get paid.

If you get paid every two weeks or randomly, That's okay we are still going to look at your budget once a week (or more if you're real motivated).

https://giphy.com/gifs/give-it-to-me-nh9k1qzeLf99S

<<Accounts>>

It's time to learn your weekly budget routine.

<<Accounts>>

Second, add the transactions that you placed on your Credit Card(s). Make sure the balance matches in MyBudgetCoach. 

This will decrease the 'To Budget' number.

<<Budget>>

You may have noticed the numbers in parentheses next to the category names. These numbers represent the due dates. You can now update them to match your bill due dates and drag them into the desired order!

<<Accounts>>

Third, pay off your Credit Card balance from the past week. Do this now, and I'll show you how to make this payment transfer in MyBudgetCoach next.

Ideally, the balance should be zero each week.

This will NOT affect the 'To Budget' number because you are just transferring money, not actually spending it on a purchase.

<<Budget>>

Fifth, allocate the 'To Budget' amount to upcoming bills and expenses that are coming up for the next paycheck and beyond.

<<Accounts>>

First, add the transacations from your checking account to make sure the balance matches in MyBudgetCoach. 

Adding your paycheck will increase the 'To Budget' number.
move_to: budget_table
move_to: category_column
move_to: budgeted_column
move_to: balance_column

<<Accounts>>

To input the credit card payment you just made select the credit card account under 'All accounts' and select 

'Add New'
move_to: add_new_button

<<Accounts>>

Now you are going to select the bank account you just paid your credit card with under Payee. 

In the dropdown list, it will be listed under 

'Transfer To/From'
move_to: select_payee

<<Accounts>>

Add the amount you just paid under 

'Deposit'
move_to: deposit_input

<<Accounts>>

Save all your hard work by selecting

'Add'
move_to: save_transaction

<<Accounts>>

You did a great job, but before you pat yourself on the back there are two more things ðŸ˜²

<<Accounts>>

The fourth step is to pay your upcoming bills and record them in MyBudgetCoach. 

Ohh that reminds me I have to clean out my junk drawer ðŸ˜­

<<Budget>>

Remember when you added dates in parentheses beside bills? 

Now you are going to use those dates as references for where your 'To Budget' money should be allocated to set you up for the next paycheck. 

This is also the time when you want to add some money to those Stacks.

<<Budget>>

Go to the 'Budgeted' column and allocate the 'To Budget' money now. Make sure your expenses are covered first before you add extra money to your stacks. The goal is to get the 'To Budget' number down to zero.

<<Budget>>

Did your "To Budget" amount turn negative?

<<Budget>>

That's okay. We can set up a Credit Card "bill" so we can work on paying that off in the future. Let's do that now.

<<Budget>>

On the budget screen, Add a category under Recurring Bills and name it the name of your 'Credit Card'  + Payment. 

For example: American Express Payment

<<Accounts>>

Click on the Credit Card name on the left hand side under Accounts. On the line that says Starting Balance change the CATEGORY name to the name of the 'Credit Card' Payment in the drop down list. This will be the name of the credit card under Recurring Bills (this is not the payee name)

<<Budget>>

You can see that the "To Budget" will be back to the higher amount. You will also see a negative red balance on the budget sheet under Recurring Bills under the 'Credit Card' Payment that you just entered.

<<Budget>>

Let's say you paid 200 dollars off on your credit card but your balance is still negative. For the next month you can click on the red negative number under Balance and select 'Rollover Overspending' to push the remaining balance off to the next month. You would keep paying more and more off on this card and eventually pay it off completely.

<<Budget>>

In the future, we are going to pay off your credit card every week so it becomes a regular habit, and you never have to worry about credit card debt again. It is much better to have money working for you than against you on a credit card!

<<Budget>>

That's what I like to hear. We are going to get into the habit of paying off your credit card each week. That way we get the rewards without the debt!

<<Budget>>


Great job completing this section! Let's move on to your weekly routine. After a few weeks, they will become habits. My goal for you is to have virtual stacks and stacks of money!

Budget Table Overview

<<Budget>>

This is the budget table, basically a digital cash envelope system! You create categories relevant to your life and budget dollars accordingly.

<<Budget>>

The Category column houses the names of each category. We'll get customizing these in a bit.

<<Budget>>

The Budgeted column is where you'll be budgeting your dollars. This shows you what you have allocated each month for the categories.

<<Budget>>

Next up is the Spent column. This shows you what you've actually spent out of the budgeted dollars.

<<Budget>>

The last column is Balance. This shows you what you have available to spend. If it's negative and red, you've overspent in this category. If the amount is black, that's what you have available.

If you don't cover this overspending, you either risk over-drafting your checking account or adding debt to your credit card. More on this later!

<<Budget>>

Trusting Your Numbers

One of the complexities for users with a zero-based budgeting software is the due diligence to ensure the account balances in MyBudgetCoach match the account balances in the financial institution. 

A difficult part of having the accounts match is ensuring the starting balance set by the user at the time the accounts are added are accurate. For checking accounts, some banks include pending transactions in the Current Balance. If the starting balance includes pending transactions, then when the transactions are added, they will be double counted. For credit cards, the Current Balance doesn't include pending transactions, so this is not an issue. 

Coach can consider consulting Coach Trainers to add a flow for verifying starting balance.

Coach option to offer email for users to contact you directly prior to a call. Could help with triaging if a call is needed, versus hopping on a call and then realizing there isn't enough information.

People who have Credit Card balances in excess of their available dollars in their checking account will have a negative amount To Budgeted. This is an important step for the user, but can be handled in a various number of ways. Consider the main steps the user needs to complete, and then determine as the coach if you want to add more detail for any of those steps:

1) Adding the Credit Card Category Group
2) Add a Category for each Credit Card
3) Changing the category on the account side of the Credit Card starting balance to the newly created Category
4) Rollover overspending if not going to pay off balance

This will give the user back their dollars in their checking account in the To Budgeted.

You as the Coach can do as much or as little as you would like for the user. For example, if you just want to add a handful of categories, or walk them through how to edit and add themselves, that is fine. Alternatively, you could have the system build an entire budget with defined groups, and categories, so when they select the button before the template is built, it automatically updates.

Welcome to MyBudgetCoach(MBC)! You just made a GREAT financial decision. ðŸ¥‚ðŸŽ‰ MBC is different because it comes with a real-life coach AND a digital avatar to make sure you are successful. You selected Daniel as your coach!

Hi Daniel, Let's get started!

First, let's go over a few housekeeping items. I am the avatar version of Daniel so you can't ask me questions directly. When you need help you can pay a small fee to talk to the real me by clicking "Zoom with Daniel" 

Nice, I can book a call if needed. 

If you get lost you can hit the back button or even reset the whole avatar by hitting Reset Daniel. 

Good to know.

Oh and since I'm actually a real person (no offense ChatGPT) I'll be sharing a few personal things about me as we go. That way when you decide to chat in real life we will already be best friends. 

Awesome, I love friends!
Chill bro, we just met ðŸ˜‚


I will be going over everything with you to get you started. I will even help you build a budget WITHOUT tracking every single purchase. 

Nobody has time for that. gif

MyBudgetCoach will introduce a new method for managing your money, which may get a little tricky initially, but with me as your coach, I'll guide you through a simple process to ensure you stay committed to budgeting for years to come.


Are you budgeting with a partner?

Yes / No

Yes: Aww. Those who budget together...stay together. What is their name?
No: Nice. Easy...peasy

Perfect! I am excited to work with you and [[partner_name]] throughout the tutorial! 

Enough small talk let's gooooooo!

Alright, It's time to get started. Feel free to take a break or book a call at any point. I'll be here to pick up where you left off. 

Soooo, here is the list of what we will be going over: 
1. Account Tour & Setup
2. How to Add Transactions
3. Trusting Your Numbers 
4. Budget Tour & Setup
5. Budget Skills

https://giphy.com/gifs/seinfeld-preseason-aMh59aKR8vjdC

<<Accounts>>

Now, you need to pick a time weekly to update your budget and pay bills. Ideally you would have this day on or a few days after you get paid.

If you get paid every two weeks or randomly, That's okay we are still going to look at your budget once a week (or more if you're real motivated)

<<Accounts>>

Second, add the transactions that you placed on your Recurring Credit Card and Stacks Credit Card. 

We don't have to add the transactions for the Spend Credit Card.

<<Accounts>>

Third, pay off the full balance you put on the Spend Credit Card from the past week using your primary checking account. 

And pay off the Stacks credit card using the Ally or High Yield Savings Account.

Ideally these should be paid back to zero each week.

<<Budget>>

Fourth, allocate the To Budget amount to upcoming bills and expenses and pay those bills now.

<<Accounts>>

First, add the transacations from your checking account to make sure the balance matches in MyBudgetCoach.
Stacking Method Removed from liver verson for now. May add back later as an option

<<Budget>>

Take a few minutes to go over these categories. Notice how we have three major groups 
1. Spend 
2. Recurring 
3. Stacks

<<Budget>>

The Spend group is going to be for Groceries, Car Fuel, Lunches/Snacks, Random small spending. This group is designed for all those little credit card swipes so you don't have to track every little thing.

<<Budget>>

We find that people stay on track and have more success when budgeting is a weekly habit.

<<Budget>>

The Second group is Recurring. Since you are so smart you might have realized that there are two Recurring sections. The First is Recurring BILLS that you pay directly out of your checking account. Think utilities.

<<Budget>>

The Second is Recurring Credit Card CHARGES. These are monthly credit charges. Think Cable, Netflix, Gym memberships, etc...

<<Budget>>

The third category is Stacks, reserved for less frequent but significant expenses such as home repairs, holidays, birthdays, vacations, or purchasing a new car. I keep my Stacks in Ally but any other High Yield Savings Account will work!

<<Budget>>

The method works best if you have a dedicated credit card for each group. So, three credit cards. Spend, Recurring, and Stacks.

<<Budget>>

If you want me to explain this in detail for your specefic situation, book a call with me and I'd be happy to make sure you are set up correctly.

<<Budget>>

Great job sticking through that. This is the end of the Budget section. Lets move on to setting up your Credit Cards.

<<Budget>>

One of my favorite Stacks is the Vacation Spend Money Stack. This way I have money to spend when I go snowboarding with my wife and boys without feeling guilty.

<<Budget>>

You may have noticed the numbers in parenthesis next to the category names. This is the date they are due. You can now update these numbers to when your bills are due.

<<Budget>>

We are going to start with adding 2 credit cards. The credit card you use for your recurring charges and the credit card you use for your Stacks.

<<Budget>>

When you add a credit card the balance will automatically reduce your To Budget number by the full balance of that credit card. So if you carry a balance on that credit card we will have to add a credit card payment category under Recurring Bills so you can tackle paying off the credit card as a monthly bill instead of all at once.

<<Budget>>

Click on + Add account on the left hand side. You can create a local account or set up SimpleFIN bank sync for a small additional charge. I recommend setting up a local account so you manually input the numbers for now.

<<Accounts>>

Add the name of your Credit Card and input the balance. Purchases will be inputed under payment. When you make a payment to your credit card it will go under Deposit.

<<Budget>>

If you have a main credit card that has monthly charges, I would use that as your recurring charges Credit Card.

<<Accounts>>

Now add the 2nd credit card by clicking + Add account on the left hand side. This will be the credit card you use when you spend from your Stacks. Repeat the same process you did with the first credit card.  

We are NOT adding the 3rd 'Spend' Credit Card because we are not going to track every purchase.

NO
1_credit_card = no

YES
1_credit_card = yes

<<Accounts>>

Have you already added 1 credit card?
